info.title: Agent Builder API
info.description:
**API for Managing and Invoking AI Agents**
- [User Guide](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/category/user-guide)
  - [Quick Start Guide](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/AgentBuilderPlatform/UserGuide/quickstart)
  - [Supported LLMs](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/AgentBuilderPlatform/UserGuide/supported_llms)
  - [Authorization](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/AgentBuilderPlatform/UserGuide/authorization)
  - [RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation)](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/AgentBuilderPlatform/UserGuide/rag)
  - [Tool Agent](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/AgentBuilderPlatform/UserGuide/tool_agent)
  - [Task Agent](https://hyland.github.io/ContentIntelligence-Docs/AgentBuilderPlatform/UserGuide/task_agent)

get.description: Get metadata for all agents in the current tenant as well as the global agents.

post.description: Create a new agent with an initial version and log the creation action for the tenant.

get.description: Get permissions based off an agent id

put.description: Update the user permission restrictions for an agent in the current tenant by adding/updating required user groups.

get.description: Get all versions of a specific agent for the tenant or global.

post.description: Update an agent by adding a new version for the current tenant.

get.description: Get a specific version of an agent.

post.description:
Get agents and their latest versions for a batch of agent IDs.
    
**Batch Limits:** Maximum 100 agent IDs allowed per request.
Lookup an agent based on a name and optional version label

delete.description: Delete an agent and corresponding versions and permissions. Log the delete action for the current tenant.

patch.description: Update agent name and/or description for the current tenant.

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of available LLM models with their metadata.
Retrieves a paginated list of available guardrails.

post.description: Invoke an agent and return the response.

post.summary: [EXPERIMENTAL] Invoke tool or rag agent with streaming response
post.description: Invoke an agent and stream the response.

Creates a new file upload session by generating a presigned URL for direct
S3 upload. Clients use the returned uploadUrl to upload the file directly to S3,
bypassing the server.

Invoke a task agent using structured inputs instead of messages.
This endpoint forwards the request to the agent runtime for processing.

post.summary: [EXPERIMENTAL] Invoke task agent with streaming response
post.description:
Invoke a task agent using structured inputs and stream the response.
This endpoint forwards the request to the agent runtime for processing.

get.description: Get all MCP servers for the current tenant and global servers.
Get a specific MCP server by ID.
Get tools from a specific MCP server using the MCP Protocol.

sourceNodes.text: AVAILABILITY OF HANDBOOK AND POLICY UPDATES A copy of this handbook, Company policies and any updates made to them is available for viewing on the HR Portal located at classified_url It is your responsibility to be aware of the handbook and policies and any changes made to them. Hyland reserves the right to make changes to the handbook and policies at any time with no advance notice given.

content.text: Detailed information about the company's sick leave policy and other HR policies can be found on the HR Portal located at classified_url. This portal contains a copy of the Employee Handbook, company policies, and any updates made to them. It is important to regularly check this portal to stay informed about any changes to the policies. If you have any questions regarding these policies, you are encouraged to contact the Human Resources department.

name.description: A name for the document. Min 1, Max 200 chars. Allowed: alphanumeric, single spaces, hyphens, parentheses, square brackets. Note: This field is vulnerable to prompt injections; use a neutral name.

answer.title: Answer
answer.description: Used by answer event to display the answer of the question

UIEventData.title: UIEventData
UIEventData.description:
Events for DeepResearch workflow which has 3 main stages:
- Retrieve: Retrieve information from the knowledge base.
- Analyze: Analyze the retrieved information and provide list of questions for answering.
- Answer: Answering the provided questions. There are multiple answer events, each with its own id that is used to display the answer for a particular question.

mediaType.description: Optional: The media type of the image, e.g., image/jpeg. If 'image/tiff', URL extension is checked.
